intro: Phyllolobium lachungense, commonly known as the Lachung phyllolobium, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant is typically found in moist, forested areas at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and usually pale in color, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
